channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No street lighting in Walnut Close for a week., 16th April
item.description:
All lighting is off from the junction of Walnut Close with Evesham Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Approach Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pot hole in road hard to avoid as other pot holes coming on other side, 16th April
item.description:
Along Claydon road, GL20 7NH people now causing mud and debris onto road as driving onto side, in turn more pot holes are coming, very deep pot hole one side of road smaller ones coming on the other.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree cracking path and driveway, 16th April
item.description:
Outside my house 74 Brooklyn gardens Cheltenham GL51 8LW. The tree has just got worse and worse over the last few years the roots are now pulling up the pavement and as you can see in the pictures has cracked and jolted up our driveway now so we are now going to have to fix our driveway. I have been given your contact details through Cheltenham council and hoping you can help many thanks c fry my mobile number is 07770849365

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Arle Drive, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous very large potholes on the carriageway from Arle Court Roundabout heading to the M5Junction., 15th April
item.description:
Numerous very large and dangerous potholes on inside lane of the A40 from Arle Court roundabout to the M5 junction. Very dangerous as unavoidable. Very poor/dangerous road condition on a very busy and fast road. Only a matter of time before someone has a blow out and a serious accident happens! This road has been patched badly before. Please repair it properly this time!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 15th April
item.description:
In road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car with no tax or MOT is parked on the road, 15th April
item.description:
On the pavement between 8 and 10. The car has been there for at least 4 months. It has flat tyres and is green with mould.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmgrove Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Carriageway dangerously full of pot holes, 15th April
item.description:
Both sides of the road, towards the centre white line. You say there are major roadworks planned, but this cannot wait until July - vehicles are in danger of being damaged now and it has been getting worse for several weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4079, Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Approx 12 inch pothole which is line with normal travel, 15th April
item.description:
Entering from Cheltenham Road just before the junction to the mini roundabout turning left to Tesco's
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester

item.title: Traffic light green phase not long enough, 15th April
item.description:
The sequencing has recently changed leading to huge tailbacks in the a417 coming from c&g roundabout. At all times of the day and totally unacceptable during rush hour. This has been reported numerous times over the last week yet nothing happened. It affects school traffic massively every morning. Sort it out please or provide a reason for the sequence change.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple sacks of what apears to be soil/gravel have been partially spilling onto the carriageway for several weeks, 15th April
item.description:
These are directly opposite the entrance to Colgate Farm, Ham Hill. They have been there for many weeks despite being reported to the council website.

item.title: Numerous potholes on this road, 15th April
item.description:
Between the Racecourse roundabout and the junction with Marle HIl roundabout there are numerous potholes which due to their depth and frequency, are affecting how people drive in that area. This is a danger to all road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 15th April
item.description:
Customer reports multiple potholes along the stretch of road. However, they can be found largely around either side of the of the ford. They are around 12" in diameter (depth uknown) and full of water - potentially a danger to motorcycles.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th April
item.description:
Customer states that a tree branch has fallen of a tree and has gone through her windscreen. They need looking at as limbs fall of these regularly and need looking at again, they were looked at last year. Customer wants to make a claim.
Report on FixMyStreet
